decks.notes: The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to efficiently control the board through removal spells and threats while ramping into powerful late-game threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck also utilizes the powerful planeswalkers Oko, Thief of Crowns and Vraska, Golgari Queen to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck features mana ramp with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose to quickly reach its powerful late-game threats. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and disrupt their game plan until it can finish the game with its powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to establish board presence quickly and aggressively using low-cost creatures and powerful Adventure cards. By utilizing cards like Questing Beast, Rankle, Master of Pranks, and Lovestruck Beast, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early on. The deck also includes removal spells like Murderous Rider and Legion's End to control the board and keep the opponent's creatures at bay. With the inclusion of Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger, the deck has additional ways to generate value and close out the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis, Voracious Hydra, and Wicked Wolf to pressure the opponent. It also ramps up mana with Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to quickly cast high-cost spells like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful planeswalkers while being able to adapt to different board states with cards like Brazen Borrower and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger. The combination of aggro creatures and strong planeswalkers makes it a versatile and formidable deck in 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalker cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the game by generating card advantage and disrupting the opponent's strategies. Alongside removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Massacre Girl, the deck aims to control the board and maintain a strong presence with efficient threats like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf. Mana ramp is provided by cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, allowing for fast deployment of high-impact spells. The deck's versatility and resilience make it a formidable force in 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions by countering spells, removing threats, and gaining card advantage. It utilizes Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down the opponent, while also running counterspells like Dovin's Veto and Absorb. Mass Manipulation and Prison Realm help to take control of the board, while Chemister's Insight provides card draw. Gadwick, the Wizened and Agent of Treachery offer additional control options. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to put early pressure on the opponent while also establishing a strong board presence. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to quickly build up a threatening board state. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World help generate advantage and create difficult to deal with threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Noxious Grasp to handle opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, backed up by strong support cards.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, mana ramp, and versatile threats to maintain board presence and put pressure on the opponent. By utilizing a combination of creature and planeswalker threats in the Sultai color combination, this deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and close out games before the opponent can recover. The deck is designed to create a fast-paced, aggressive strategy that can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victories.

The main concept of this deck is to establish board control through the use of powerful planeswalkers and removal spells, while also ramping into large threats like Hydroid Krasis. The deck utilizes cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to create value and generate advantage over the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of mana dorks and efficient creatures to further enhance its early game consistency and ability to stabilize. This Sultai Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents through a combination of powerful threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also using removal spells such as Noxious Grasp to deal with threats. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose to cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes tools for card advantage and board wipes like Massacre Girl. By combining powerful planeswalkers, removal, ramp, and card advantage, the deck seeks to out-value and outlast opponent's threats in order to secure victory.

This deck focuses on establishing board control by using powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko, along with removal spells like Noxious Grasp. It also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to quickly ramp up to play threats like Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to dominate the battlefield with versatile creatures like Wicked Wolf and Massacre Girl, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy. Its mana base ensures consistency and access to all the necessary colors for its spells.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers and spells to manipulate the board state and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck includes a combination of removal spells, card draw, and mana ramp to ensure you can outlast your opponent and ultimately overwhelm them with powerful creatures and spells. By deploying threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also utilizing powerful control spells like Time Wipe and Mass Manipulation, you can dominate the game and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to build up a strong board presence quickly through efficient mana ramp and creature plays, while also disrupting your opponent's strategy with cards like Agent of Treachery and Oko, Thief of Crowns. Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis provide additional power and card advantage, making it difficult for your opponent to keep up. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo, using the Simic color combination to take advantage of both fast creature plays and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this Simic Aggro deck is to flood the board with efficient creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko to generate advantage and disrupt opponent's strategies. With ramp cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, this deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Disdainful Stroke provides necessary counterplay against key spells, ensuring that the deck can maintain its tempo advantage and secure the win.

The main idea of this Simic Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, allowing you to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World early on. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wicked Wolf provide removal and disruption, while Mass Manipulation can swing the game in your favor by taking control of your opponent's creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of aggro creatures and powerful planeswalkers, maintaining a constant pressure throughout the game.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Gilded Goose, Questing Beast, and Wicked Wolf, while using cards like Once Upon a Time and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to ramp up mana and gain additional advantages. Disdainful Stroke provides some control against opponent's spells, while Oko, Thief of Crowns can disrupt the opponent's board while creating threats of your own. The deck also has a bit of manipulation with Mass Manipulation, and uses lands like Castle Garenbrig and Temple of Mystery to ensure smooth mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful planeswalkers and efficient removal spells while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Hydroid Krasis provide additional value and threats on the board. Deputy of Detention and Agent of Treachery help to deal with problematic permanents, while the mana base allows for consistently hitting the necessary colors to cast your spells. This deck aims to outvalue opponents through a mixture of ramp, control, and threats.

The main focus of this deck is establishing control over the game by ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Paradise Druid, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Oko, and Nissa to control the board and generate value. The deck aims to consistently play threats like Hydroid Krasis and Agent of Treachery to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Deputy of Detention. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color identity and ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this Esper Control deck is to utilize a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Kaya's Wrath, while also generating card advantage with Dance of the Manse and Wishclaw Talisman. Additionally, cards like Doom Foretold provide a win condition by slowly grinding down the opponent's resources. The deck is designed to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through carefully timed plays and resource management.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays leveraging adventure cards to generate card advantage and pressure opponents. It utilizes creatures with adventure abilities to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells. By doubling up on adventure triggers with Lucky Clover, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a stream of threats and card draw. The key is to take advantage of the synergy between adventure creatures and other cards in the deck to outvalue and outpace the opponent in the early to mid game.

The deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's board while utilizing cards like Ral's Outburst and Gadwick, the Wizened for card advantage and tempo advantage. The creatures in the deck, like Brazen Borrower and Brineborn Cutthroat, provide additional threats and ways to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, counter key spells, and slowly take control of the game through efficient removal and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures from the Adventure mechanic to put pressure on the opponent. It combines various powerful creatures, spells, and planeswalkers to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game quickly. The main strategy is to establish a board presence early on, using cards like Lovestruck Beast and Edgewall Innkeeper, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Murderous Rider and Noxious Grasp. The deck also features some powerful planeswalkers like Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to provide additional threats and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and utilizing the adventure mechanic to gain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Questing Beast and Rankle, Master of Pranks provide powerful threats, while Edgewall Innkeeper helps draw cards. The deck includes removal spells like Murderous Rider and Noxious Grasp to deal with opposing threats. Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger offer additional threats and support. The mana base includes Fabled Passage and Temple of Malady to ensure consistent mana sources. Castle Locthwain provides card draw in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use Adventure creatures and efficient removal spells to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent quickly. The deck focuses on maintaining tempo and card advantage through cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Once Upon a Time, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Questing Beast and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to close out games. The inclusion of cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Massacre Girl adds additional disruption and threat potential to keep opponents on their toes.

The main idea of this deck is to take advantage of the adventure mechanic to create a fast and aggressive gameplay style. By using cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lucky Clover, the deck can generate card advantage and create powerful board states. Questing Beast and Rankle, Master of Pranks provide a strong finisher, while cards like Murderous Rider and Noxious Grasp help to control the opponent's board. The combination of creatures and removal spells make this deck a force to be reckoned with in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with an aggressive strategy using creatures and spells in the Simic colors. The deck includes creatures such as Wildborn Preserver, Brineborn Cutthroat, and Nightpack Ambusher, along with counterspells like Frilled Mystic and Sinister Sabotage to control the game. The deck also includes card draw and ramp with Spectral Sailor and Once Upon a Time. By playing tempo-efficient threats and disrupting opponents' plans, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board using powerful green and black creatures such as Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis, while also utilizing planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate value and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Noxious Grasp to deal with problematic cards from the opponent's deck. With a variety of powerful threats and mana ramping cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, this deck aims to quickly establish dominance and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw to outvalue and outlast opponents. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral, enabling big plays with cards like Expansion / Explosion and Escape to the Wilds. The deck also includes versatile threats like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant to apply pressure when needed. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the board and resources, and eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells and card advantage.

The focus of this deck is on controlling the tempo of the game by utilizing cards that allow for efficient card draw, removal, and counter spells. By utilizing Wilderness Reclamation, the deck aims to generate mana advantage and cast powerful spells like Expansion/Explosion and Escape to the Wilds to outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes creatures like Questing Beast and Brazen Borrower for additional threat and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to ramp up its resources, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game with powerful spells and creatures.

The focus of this deck is to quickly aggro out your opponent by playing aggressive creatures that can deal damage quickly and efficiently. This deck relies on a mix of creatures with low mana costs and powerful abilities such as haste and first strike, along with Embercleave to give your creatures extra power and abilities to close out the game quickly. With a solid mana base and a consistent curve, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent before they can set up their own game plan.

This deck utilizes a mixture of powerful creatures and mana-generating cards to quickly overwhelm opponents. It focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Paradise Druid and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to play high-impact threats like Questing Beast and Hydroid Krasis. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides versatile removal and disruption, while Deputy of Detention handles problematic non-creature threats. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while efficiently utilizing its resources to outpace and outvalue opponents.

The deck focuses on quickly building a wide board presence with efficient creatures and generating value by casting spells like Once Upon a Time and Flower / Flourish. The adventure creatures provide additional utility and the Lovestruck Beast can create a 1/1 token to go wide. The deck can also generate large amounts of tokens with March of the Multitudes and can disrupt opponents' game plan with Conclave Tribunal. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy while maintaining a level of versatility and control.
